Key Match Events: The Mavericks exploded for 36 points in the fourth quarter and ended the game on a 17-2 run.
P.J. Washington tied the game at 109 with 2:26 left thanks to two free throws.
Washington drained the go-ahead corner 3-pointer to give Dallas a three-point lead.
Quentin Grimes sealed the victory with a three-point play.
Jaden Hardy scored a season-high 25 points and knocked down a season-high four 3-pointers in the second quarter.
Dereck Lively II added a season-high 21 points and a season-high 16 rebounds.
Pre-Game Insights: The game’s start time was moved up an hour due to snowy weather across the Metroplex.
Mavericks coach Jason Kidd addressed the earlier tipoff time during his pregame press conference, stating that both teams agreed to move the game up.
Post-Match Reflections: With the win, the Mavericks have won their last two games without Luka Doncic and Kyrie Irving, while clinching the season series against the Blazers 3-1.
Dallas is now 22-16 with two upcoming games against the Denver Nuggets.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The first 5,000 fans in attendance who braved the weather conditions received Daniel Gafford pins.
The NBA postponed Thursday’s game between the Lakers and Charlotte Hornets because of the fierce wildfires raving across Los Angeles.
